body_content.explanation: to repeat the words that someone else has said or written:
examples: He's always quoting from the Bible.
"If they're flexible, we're flexible", the official was quoted as saying.
She worked, to quote her daughter, "as if there were no tomorrow".
Can I quote you on that (= can I repeat to other people what you have just said)?

body_content.explanation: If you quote a fact or example, you refer to it in order to add emphasis to what you are saying:
examples: Quote me one organization that doesn't have some bad managers.

body_content.explanation: to give a price, especially one that will be charged for doing a piece of work:
examples: The architect has quoted £90,000 to build a patio.

body_content.explanation: the price that a person or company says they will charge to do a piece of work:
examples: I asked several companies to give me a quote for the building work.

body_content.explanation: the symbols “ ” or ‘ ’ that are put around a word or phrase to show that someone else has written or said it:
examples: You need to make sure that any quotes in your document are coded properly.
